### About Me

I'm a software developer, motorsport enthusiast, and hobbyist engineer from the UK!

  </a>
</p>

I currently work at [Protirus](https://protirus.com/about.html) delivering high-quality data loss prevention solutions
<br>
I've gained experience using C#, Powershell, SQL, Python, Azure DevOps, HTML/CSS/JS, Salesforce, and more!
<br>
<br>
If you're an employer and think I might be a good fit for you, feel free to get in touch!
<br>
One of the best ways to contact me is to connect on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/seanapatterson/) - from there I can send you my CV or schedule a call

<br>

### My Education

<p>
  <a href="https://modref.github.io/papers/ModRef2023_TowardsAutomaticDesignOfFactorioBlueprints.pdf">
  <img alt="St Andrews Graduate" src="https://img.shields.io/badge/St%20Andrews%20Graduate-ee312a?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=fff&logo=data:image/png;base64,">
  </a>
  <img alt="Arkwright Engineering Alumnus" src="https://img.shields.io/badge/Arkwright%20Engineering%20Alumnus-F7A605?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=fff&logo=data:image/png;base64,"
</p>

I have an MSci (Hons) First Class in Computer Science from St Andrews
<br>
My dissertation, *Blueprint Design Optimisation in Factorio* was presented at ModRef 2023 - [check out the paper here!](https://modref.github.io/papers/ModRef2023_TowardsAutomaticDesignOfFactorioBlueprints.pdf)
<br>
It explores the use of constraint programming techniques against a combination of classical computing problems such as bin-packing, pathfinding, and network flow maximisation in the context of Factorio blueprints
<br>
<br>
Alongside this, I was electronics lead for the St Andrews Formula Student team and a driver for the [BUKC](https://bukc.co.uk/) team
<br>
Before uni, I got involved in a number of initiatives such as the Arkwright Engineering Scholarship and Cyber Discovery

<br>

---

### My Hobbies

I enjoy parkrunning, karting, and doing programming/engineering projects
<br>
<br>
I've also done my fair share of hackathons, mostly alongside [@btRooke](https://github.com/btRooke)
<br>
Here are some highlights:<br>

| **When?**            | **What?**                                                                        | **Why?**                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Stacshack 2021       | [Chrome Chats](https://github.com/btRooke/chrome-chats)                          | We wanted to make a chrome extension, and the idea of every webpage being its own chatroom was really fun - so fun we got 2nd place!                                                      |
| Hack the Burgh VIII  | [Verble](https://github.com/btRooke/verble)                                      | Wordle was all the rage, and AssemblyAI was offering free API access to competitors <br> Who doesn't want to shout random 5-letter words into a microphone in the early hours of the morning? |
| Hack the Bubble 2022 | [Musical Datagram Protocol](https://github.com/btRooke/musical-datagram-protcol) | You can't leave musical instruments lying around and expect us **not** to use them...                                                                                                     |
| Stacshack 2023       | [JH-Compute](https://github.com/btRooke/JH-compute)                              | You can't leave a lab full of PCs lying around and expect us **not** to use them...                                                                                                       |
